algorithms.name: FCFS
algorithms.description: First-Come, First-Served (FCFS) is the simplest scheduling algorithm that schedules processes in the order they arrive in the ready queue. It is non-preemptive and ensures that processes are handled in a straightforward, sequential manner.

example.subDes: NOTE: if there is no any process in execution queue and current time is 0 then process which arrived first will be added in execution queue and then it will follow the actual way of scheduling

algorithms.name: SJF
algorithms.description: Shortest Job First (SJF) schedules processes based on the shortest burst time first. It can be preemptive or non-preemptive. In the non-preemptive version, once a process starts, it cannot be interrupted until it finishes.

example.subDes: NOTE: if there is no any process in execution queue and current time is 0 then process which arrived first will be added in execution queue and then it will follow the actual way of scheduling

algorithms.name: Priority
algorithms.description: Priority Scheduling assigns priorities to processes and schedules them based on these priorities. Higher priority processes are executed before lower priority ones. It can be preemptive or non-preemptive.

example.subDes: NOTE: if there is no any process in execution queue and current time is 0 then process which arrived first will be added in execution queue and then it will follow the actual way of scheduling
